episodes.title: Interview with Jess Piper about the "Fundie Baby Voice"
episodes.description:
After Senator Katie Britt's response to the State of the Union went viral for all the wrong reasons, Jess Piper wrote about how her voice was all too familiar. It had all the hallmarks of a "well-practiced fundie baby voice."

That voice, famously used by Michelle Duggar and so many others, is a phenomenon worth exploring, and there's no one better than Jess to speak to about it. 

You can read Jess' article here: https://jesspiper.substack.com/p/the-fundie-baby-voice

episodes.title: Norwegian court upholds ban on state funding for Jehovah's Witnesses (Livestream)
episodes.description:
A Norwegian court upheld a decision to rescind the "religious community" status of the Jehovah's Witnesses, a move that blocks the JWs from receiving taxpayer-funded subsidies and performing legal marriages. 

It was the group's cult-like behavior that led to their punishment.

This is a clip from my recent livestream: 
https://youtu.be/VEv1WSoPokY

The article this is based on is here: 
https://www.friendlyatheist.com/p/norwegian-court-upholds-ban-on-state

episodes.title: A chat with Andrew Pledger, host of "Surviving Bob Jones University: A Christian Cult"
episodes.description:
Andrew Pledger is a former student at Bob Jones University, a fundamentalist Christian school with a long and not-so-great history. He's also the host of a new podcast called Surviving Bob Jones University: A Christian Cult." 

The stories in that podcast are depressing as all hell but they're so important to hear if you want to get a real sense of what schools like these do to people.

You can listen to the podcast here: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/surviving-bob-jones-university-a-christian-cult/id1681943920
